text.title: 13 *horrible* truths about living in London
text.p: this video is sponsored by my favorite
website Creator squ space the best place
to go when you want to get a domain or
create a beautiful website or an online
store okay one thing that happens almost
all the time when you tell someone you
live in London who doesn't live in
London themselves is that they go oh but
London is so this or that and like
people in even London are so XYZ there
are so many opinions and myths about
life in London that I'm doing my duty as
a Londoner of almost 10 years now I'm
going to truthfully answer the question
are all the horrible myths about London
really true well we'll see I asked you
on Instagram a while back to tell me
your myths about London and there were
by far two myths that were repeated
again and again and again more than
anything else the first one of them
being that London is extremely expensive
and you can really only live here
decently and safely if you're like
stinking rich is that true overall I
would say yes I wouldn't say you have to
be stinking rich but you definitely have
to make like not only a comfortable
salary but a good salary to live here
nicely I know a lot of londoners who
make a decent salary but still can't
afford to live in areas that are like
truly nice and safe and London is so
massive to be able to like buy something
like a flat or Terrace House people move
like further and further out where it
takes like forever to get to Central
most people in London though make
nowhere near enough money to even think
about buying their own home and this is
one of the main reasons we left London
the first time we lived here we just
didn't feel that we could like live
decently and nicely with the money we
were making at the time now we live like
really well but it has taken us years of
like making good money and saving
ruthlessly to be able to buy this flat
which is in a nice and safe area I'm
still like pinching myself that would
like pull it off in London so yes
expensive hell the myth is definitely
true sad to say but the even more common
myth that you mentioned on Instagram was
that it's always raining in London the
weather is like gray Bleak sad and you
can never leave the house without an
umbrella this my friends it's not true I
mean we moved here from Stockholm which
actually has more yearly precipitation
the London I think the difference is
that in London it rains quite often but
only for like you know these 10minute
dly little mini showers whereas if it
rains in Stockholm or in other places it
really rains for like a whole day or at
least for like hours at a time so even
though the weather app shows like chance
of rain quite often it's usually like
nothing like a little shower at 2: a.m.
so I actually find Len to have
incredibly beautiful weather a lot of
sun a lot of light fluffy clouds usually
like very bomy and semiwarm like perfect
walking around a city type of weather or
like what I like to call Gilmore Girls
weather you know like every season being
quite lovely with inoffensive weather
even though the seasons change
throughout the year so as you can hear
the myth is false and truly I have
nothing to complain about when it comes
about the weather everyone and I mean
everyone loves to talk about
londoners so the next few myths are
about like the specific type of person
who lives here and one myth which I'm
very sad to say is true
is the myth of the flaky Londoner if you
make a plan with a Londoner don't expect
that plan to happen like late arrivals
date cancellations rain checks and like
last minute I'm feeling a little under
the weather text are like all very
common occurrences and as a natural born
swed I have a really hard time handling
this I think if you make a plan you like
you stick to it unless you have you know
projectile vomiting food poisoning or
something I'm not adjusting well to the
fact that I can never know if a planned
date would actually happen cancelling I
find it incredibly rude and I'm not
going to assimilate to this particular
London culture next myth londoners are
rude and stressed no not true I mean of
course you will find some rude and
stressed people it's not uncommon to
like run into them in a city is huge and
this hectic like Rush our tube traffic
it's not nice but in general londoners
are in my opinion absolutely lovely like
when I go on my daily walk old men will
like tip their cap and like greet me
good morning or like people will help
you with directions if you are lost or
like strangers will come up to you and
you say that you look nice if you have
dressed up a bit and if you drop
something like on the street people will
stop and help you pick it up I find that
overall like of course depending a bit
on which part of London you're in you
know like touristy Central areas are a
bit less so but overall the mood is very
kind and polite and sweet you will find
rud people of course but you will find
many many more kind and lovely people
another myth about The Londoner that
they are snobs snobbism is Alive and
Well in London definitely for me coming
from socialist Sweden where we of course
do have a class system too but a much
more subtle and less obvious one to see
like the extreme class system in London
has been quite unnerving if you come
from money or if you have an education
from you know Oxbridge you make damn
sure it's audible in your accent people
flash money like mad over here and it's
like common to try to sound posher than
you actually are but on the other hand
there's also a lot of workingclass Pride
with people from like less affl areas
sticking to their own like lovely London
area specific accents and speaking with
such love and Nostalgia and pride about
their part of the city so yes snobbism
is everywhere but thank God there's also
like a lot of workingclass Pride too
this next one is a weird one the myth
that London is extremely crowded and
Loud the reason this is a weird myth is
because I think it's relative of course
it depends on like where you are in
London like if you do your shopping on
Oxford Street and you're eating out in
stoo then of course it's going to be
absolute Madness so I think most
tourists gets this impression because
all tourists go to the more or less the
same places but often you can like
Venture just one or two streets away
from a busy street and find it really
really quite calm and quiet and for us
who live here who have like homes a bit
away from Central like you can walk
around the park and feel really quite
alone like except for the birds I mean
not really alone but at least very far
from crowded the other reason I think
this is relative is because I think
Crowds Are a thing you sort of get used
to like when we moved back here after 3
years in Berlin we were quite
overwhelmed by the masses of people and
the loudness still I find going out for
like a drink or for dinner to usually be
quite too loud for my liking but is
nowhere near as overwhelming as when we
first came back after Berlin on the
other hand now that we are used to
crowds going back to Sweden to visit or
Berlin for example or indeed any other
smaller City it always feels like we
step off the plane to a city who's been
like struck by a zombie apocalypse the
streets are so empty the restaurants are
all like half full and quiet it's Airy
it's not nice at all you feel like all
exposed and like you're not not in a
city at all boring that's what a City
without the crowds feel like now so yes
you do get used to it but what about
where you live is it empty and quiet or
crowded and loud and what do you prefer
I'll choose the like bustling crowded
streets and like millions of people any
day City girl that's what I am I've
talked about this before the absolutely
ridiculous wealth Gap in London and it's
true the everyday life of like working
class middle class and upper class
people people is massively different
that is like hard to grasp that we all
live in the same city with such
variation in like quality of life it's
the most saddening aspect of London and
the one thing that I would most like to
change we need some of that like Swedish
socialism over here to like even out
rents and house prices and to tax the
rich and to raise minimum wage and make
everyone feel like they're a valued part
of this extraordinary City and everyone
deserves to feel safe and have the same
Quality Health and education as the
wealthy londoners next myth London is
dirty compared to Sweden yes otherwise
it's actually quite clean and pretty
another really unsavory myth that people
lie to you here and that companies trick
you basically that you can't trust
anyone I'm afraid to say it's not a myth
that I can completely debunk actually
besides from rent prices this was our
number one reason for leaving London the
first time we lived here
there we were two sweets utterly naive
and gullible coming from a country where
people trust each other and we all
believe in the goodness of people and we
found ourselves in the Cutthroat dog eat
dog world of Metropolitan London did we
get scammed did we get tricked did we
trust people we should not have trust
God yes like here you can't even trust
your own doctor like your dentist will
try to sell you treatments you don't
need phone companies straight up lie to
your face or over the phone and doing
renovation
like forget about it it was a nightmare
I do believe London is no worse than any
other cities though in fact I believe
London is better than most big cities
but as a Swede the struggle is real and
you have to like develop your
detector really quite Pronto or you will
lose your money and your pride next myth
London flats are substandard true
they're just horrible what about London
is dangerous no I don't think so again
it depends on where in London you are
and what type of person you are I don't
feel like nearly as safe in London as I
do in Stockholm but I do feel quite safe
like I'm a bit on God but I'm not sure
if that's even based on the reality of
like crime rates or if that's just me
being influenced by like fear-mongering
as a woman when it comes to like sexual
harassment or being like bothered by men
on the street or in bars or like cat
calling or whatever I feel like it's
much much better than most places as a
woman I feel mostly safe and and I
witnessed like very few crimes at all in
my 10 years as a resident another myth
is that it's hard to find friends
compared to many other places I would
say this is true like when we moved to
Berlin it was so easy to get to know
people but here it has taken years to
grow like a nice close friend Circle I
think it's because this old tradition in
England that like if you want to meet
someone you have to first be introduced
by a common friend it's like sometimes
considered weird to just like walk up to
someone and introduce yourself but of
course if you're an immigrant who
doesn't know anyone there's like no
common friend to introduce you to anyone
so I just had to like keep reaching out
being weird making a fool out of myself
to like find those like two out of 10
people who find it refreshing that I
just like out of the blue DM them to ask
if we can be friends I think this is why
it's easier with other immigrants well
like I always love immigrants most in
every country anyway wonderful people my
kind of people the M that London wears
you out is another myth I used to find
this to be true that to be like happy in
London you need to take long calm breaks
in like the countryside once in a while
to like not go mad but now ever since we
moved into this flat which is in like a
calm green residential area I don't feel
like this anymore I think it's like the
greenery and the quiet like if you can
find a place in London like an area like
this it cancels the stress and like the
need to get some air and like time away
from the city in fact what I do feel to
an almost overwhelming degree is that I
don't want to leave I don't want to go
on holiday I don't want to go back to
Sweden I don't want to like even leave
London for a day trip I just want to be
here like at home at peace and in the
lovely beautiful mad bustle of the city
because truth be told I never felt this
at home anywhere else London is like the
love of mine and David's life I walked
down the street and I still to this day
almost 10 years in I still can't quite
believe that I get to live here that I
get to call myself that beautiful word a
Londoner where do you live how are you
feeling about your city or town or
Village are you as at home as I am or
are you like ready to move to a new
place or maybe even become an immigrant
yourself I could highly recommend it
it's hard but it's worth it like the
excitement and sense of agend Venture is
like nothing else wherever you are in
the world I hope you feel at home and
like you belong and after all this
moving here and there and like staying
in what 15 Flats in 15 years I think I
can finally say that yes I do feel that
that I belong and I just want to stay
put but if you want me to I'll of course
gladly talk more about the quirky
culture of London or the Socialist
wonders of Sweden or all the angry
shouting in Berlin let me know if so and
give me a like And subscribe if you
haven't yet why don't you oh and if you
want more you can of course buy my first
novel which is set in London or
pre-order my second novel which is set
in Stockholm with all the moods and
atmospheres of these two lovely cities
now do you want to create a beautiful
site or maybe start your own blog if so
you should definitely do it with
Squarespace listen to this with a new
guided design system square space
blueprint you can choose from
professionally curated layouts and
styling options to build a unique online
presence from the ground up square space
is also amazing with blogging tools so
share your stories photos and videos to
make it easy to reach your audience you
can also autopost your content to
Twitter Facebook and Tumblr they also
have great traffic analytics so that you
can see how many people are visiting
your site how long they're staying for
where they're coming from and what
they're interested in like traveling or
health or maybe fashion for example so
what are you waiting for go get your
free Tri today at squarespace.com and
when you're ready to launch go to squar
SP .com/briowfc
[Music]
